TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {54100=May also create a records, but that must be configured at run time., 134098=May also create m records however they must be configured at run time.}
textBeforeTable: Note that the actual wavelength does not affect data logging by the CPD(2) system in any way, these are provided only for ease of interpretation. 950 880 660 590 520 470 370 [1-7] designates a single digit within the range. For example “X[1-7]c” becomes “X1c” for the concentration at the first channel. The default wavelengths for each channel are: Aethalometer A record is constructed in a similar fashion. Flags are documented here. Default record contents are listed. Internally data is maintained in the CPD2 data format. In most cases full variable names is constructed by appending the instrument code after an underscore from the base name. That is a variable of “Q” on the instrument “A11” becomes “Q_A11” in the data. There are exceptions for instruments that log components that are not part of the logical instrument logger. For example the uMAC “X1” may log the variable “T_V11” in the “X1a” record. CPD2 Variables by Instrument
textAfterTable: X[1-7]c Concentration [1-7] (ng/m3) ZIr[1-7] Attenuation [1-7] Ipz[1-7] Sample zero [1-7] Ip[1-7] Sample intensity [1-7] Ifz[1-7] Reference zero [1-7] If[1-7] Reference intensity [1-7] Record Variables a Q;PCT;X1c;ZIr1;Ipz1;Ip1;Ifz1;If1 … X7c;ZIr7;Ipz7;Ip7;Ifz7;If7 Aethalometer AE33 [1-7] designates a single digit within the range. For example “X[1-7]c” becomes “X1c” for the concentration at the first channel. The default wavelengths for each channel are: 370 470 520 590 660 880 950 Note that the actual wavelength does not affect data logging by the CPD(2) system in any way, these are provided only for ease of interpretation.
